title: Manhattan Project National Historical Park: Donate
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Donate            Donate       In Gratitude Your interest in making a donation to Manhattan Project National Historical Park is deeply appreciated! Your support helps us complete the many important projects necessary to effectively manage and care for this special place. It's never too late to make a gift to Manhattan Project NHP.  Please read below to learn more about how you can help.           American Museum of Science & Energy Foundation   Friends of Manhattan Project National Historical Park Fund The purpose of this organization is to fund critical needs projects that help interpret the significance of Manhattan Project National Historical Park -- Oak Ridge Unit. The group accepts contributions. Contributions donated to this fund are intended for use ONLY at the Oak Ridge location. For more information on how to donate, please visit the fund's website          The Benton-Franklin River Heritage Foundation The Benton-Franklin River Heritage Foundation, a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) will receive and hold donated tax-deductible donations in a dedicated account for the Hanford Unit of the Manhattan Project national Historical Park. The donations will be transferred to the National Park Service as needed and requested by the NPS Superintendent or to the new Friends Group once it is incorporated and has received its interim tax-exempt status from the IRS.   Contributions may be sent to Visit Tri-Cities, Attn: Hanford Unit Fund, 7130 Grandridge Blvd., Suite B, Kennewick, WA 99336
